organization.name: Solidarity Workers Cooperative
organization.mission: Build a democratically governed, worker-owned enterprise that provides dignified livelihoods while modeling an equitable alternative to extractive business.

environment.content: Democratic workplaces produce better outcomes for workers, communities, and long-term business sustainability.
environment.source: Cooperative economics research and ICA reports

environment.content: Market conditions require cooperatives to be as operationally excellent as conventional businesses while maintaining democratic values.
environment.source: Competitive analysis and cooperative failure case studies

environment.content: Access to cooperative-friendly financing is limited but growing through CDFIs and cooperative loan funds.
environment.source: Lending landscape review and CDFI conversations

environment.content: Member education and governance literacy are the primary determinants of cooperative longevity.
environment.source: Cooperative development literature and peer network experience

capabilities.content: All worker-members have completed basic cooperative governance training.
We maintain a six-month operating reserve.

values.content: One member, one vote in all governance decisions.
Open and voluntary membership without discrimination.
Autonomy and independence -- the cooperative is controlled by its members.
Cooperation among cooperatives to strengthen the solidarity economy.
Concern for community -- balancing member needs with broader social impact.
Equitable patronage distribution based on labor contribution, not capital.

mission_targets.content: Achieve living wage ($25/hr minimum) for all worker-members.
Maintain 80%+ member participation in quarterly governance meetings.
Grow revenue 15% year-over-year while maintaining member well-being.
Onboard at least two new worker-members per year.

active_strategies.content: Develop a member education program covering financial literacy, governance, and conflict resolution.
Establish mentorship pipeline with experienced cooperatives in our sector.
Implement transparent open-book management so all members can read financials.

campaigns.content: Cooperative awareness campaign to attract new members from underrepresented communities.
Participate in regional cooperative development coalition for policy advocacy.

grants.content: Apply for USDA Rural Cooperative Development Grant for technical assistance.
Seek CDFI loan for equipment upgrade to increase production capacity.

principles.equity_mandate: Patronage and governance rights are distributed equitably among worker-members. Pay ratios are capped. Membership pathways are accessible to all.
principles.data_sovereignty: Member data is collectively owned by the cooperative. Financial data is open-book to all members. External sharing requires member vote.
principles.community_accountability: Major business decisions require supermajority (two-thirds) member vote. Operating decisions follow consent-based governance.

custom.name: One member one vote
custom.description: Every worker-member has exactly one vote regardless of tenure, role, or capital contribution.

custom.name: Open membership
custom.description: Membership is open to all who can use the cooperative's services and are willing to accept membership responsibilities, without gender, social, racial, political, or religious discrimination.

custom.name: Democratic member control
custom.description: Members actively participate in setting policies and making decisions. No individual or minority group can control the cooperative.

custom.name: Limited return on capital
custom.description: Capital receives limited compensation. Surplus is allocated to reserves, member benefit, or community support -- never to outside investors.

custom.name: Cooperation among cooperatives
custom.description: We actively support and trade with other cooperatives, strengthening the cooperative movement.
